revised_title: Impact Sensitivity of Propellants: Experimental Study and Mechanical Data
tldr: This study investigates the conditions that lead to the rapid deformation and ignition of double-base propellants. The authors used various techniques, including a drop-weight apparatus and a direct impact Hopkinson bar, to measure stress-strain curves at different strain rates and temperatures. They found that conventional compositions were the most sensitive to impact, and all compositions containing gas spaces were sensitized. The results provide mechanical data for hydrocode modeling of impact initiation.
